reviews.review_text: Always crowded, serves delicious meals, each item on the menu tastes awesome! Do visit this place if you want to explore the authentic Goan thali!

This restaurant is located in Mapusa however it is a bit far from Mapusa main market, rikshawala aur cab will charge around 200 to 250 rupees from Mapusa Market to reach this restaurant.

They are famous for their Malwani style fish and prawns thali and other seafood on the offering hence there is always a huge rush, expect some waiting time to get a place to sit.

Please note that there is no register or token system used for managing the waiting and at times people can break the queue which makes it frustrating for well mannered people.

Their thalis are well planned and there is a lot of items for 1 person. The 'sukka' and fried piece of fish or prrawn are very tasty. The fried Prawn are big in size and coated with Rawa masala, there is no option available to customise to non rava masala.

The shells and gravy are good too and goes well with steam rice they are served with. The yummy Sol Kadhi is brilliant to end your thali.

The food they serve is authentic Goan seafood and was delicious, with good quality and generous portions. It was definitely worth the money.
However, the service left a lot to be desired. We arrived when they were about to close, but they assured us they would still serve us. Instead, we ended up waiting for an hour, which was quite frustratingâ€”we could have gone to another place if they had just been honest about being closed.

Additionally, the waiters were unprofessional, even jokingly offering beer to my four-year-old nephew. This kind of behavior is not acceptable.

The food is great, but the service needs serious attention.
